alert.note: Alert for Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued October 31 at 6:26AM AKDT until October 31 at 1:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM AKDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 inches. Storm total snowfall since Saturday night of 8 to 18 inches, heaviest west of Tok. * WHERE...Along the Alaska Highway from Dot Lake east. * WHEN...Until 1 PM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Heavy snow will make travel difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy snow and drifting snow that started Saturday night continues this morning. Snow will taper off this afternoon. The heaviest snow is west of Tok, where both Tanacross and Robertson River will have nearly 18 inches of snow by this afternoon. The area from Tok to the the Canadian Border will have 8 to 12 inches of snow by this afternoon. Large snow drifts may form. Snow and drifting snow will taper off this afternoon.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. This will make travel very difficult or impossible. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
